TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed DataControlRowType extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Specifies the function of a row in a data control, such as a or control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The DataControlRowType enumeration identifies the function of rows in a data control. It is used by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> controls to distinguish between rows that display data and rows that display other user interface (UI) elements, such as a header row, row separator, or pager buttons.
You can use the DataControlRowType enumeration to identify the type of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow> or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRow> object when you enumerate through a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRowCollection> or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRowCollection> collection. If you are writing a data control that creates rows, you can use the DataControlRowType enumeration to identify the function of different rows in the control.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the DataControlRowType enumeration to check the type of a row when working with a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control. The `AuthorsGridView_RowCreated` method ensures that the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LinkButton.CommandArgument%2A> property of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LinkButton> control is unique for all the data rows in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control, so that when a row's <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LinkButton> control is clicked, it can be identified correctly.
[!code-cs[GridViewCommandEventArgs#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.web.ui.webcontr_97_1.aspx)] [!code-vb[GridViewCommandEventArgs#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.web.ui.webcontr_97_1.aspx)]

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlRowType DataRow = int32(2)

Docs.summary: A data row of a data control. Only DataRow rows can be data-bound.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlRowType EmptyDataRow = int32(5)

Docs.summary: The empty row of a data-bound control. The empty row is displayed when the data-bound control has no records to display and the template is not .

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlRowType Footer = int32(1)

Docs.summary: A footer row of a data control. Footer rows cannot be data-bound.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlRowType Header = int32(0)

Docs.summary: A header row of a data control. Header rows cannot be data-bound.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlRowType Pager = int32(4)

Docs.summary: A row that displays pager buttons or a pager control. Pager rows cannot be data-bound.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlRowType Separator = int32(3)

Docs.summary: A row separator. Row separators cannot be data-bound.
